Legal_Issue: Was the Board's credibility determination of the applicants patently unreasonable, warranting judicial review?
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application based on Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Credibility_Assessment: Board found numerous contradictions in the applicants' testimony
Basis_of_Claim: Refugee status due to persecution in DRC
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Breach of procedural fairness regarding specialized knowledge
Review_Outcome: Application dismissed, no new hearing granted
Assessment_Standard: Standard of review for credibility determinations is patent unreasonableness unless procedural fairness was breached
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision was not patently unreasonable
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Cause_of_Refusal: Applicants deemed non-credible by the Board
Procedural_Fairness: Breach of procedural fairness regarding specialized knowledge, but did not affect credibility findings
